pros: My career at CHC was perfect
cons: 10 and 11 hour shifts on Mondays and Tuesdays.

pros: Set hours, decent benefits, on site management was great.
cons: Upper management, patients can be unrefined.

review_title: Good benefits and a great place to work.

cons: Longer hours on Monday's and Tuesday's.

pros: Benefits are good. Good 403b
cons: Patient load is way too much. They basically drown the provider. Can’t finish notes during pay and always taking work home

job_title: Dental Assistant in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: The only pros is the Benefits

job_title: Physician Assistant in Winter Garden, FL
pros: Serving the underserved was rewarding Patient access to labs, xray, dental
cons: Management restricted bonus to harder level of achievement

review_title: It’s ok depending on which center
pros: If you have zero experience you’ll get the job easy.
cons: High turnover rate most centers are extremely understaffed. Very high patient load in all centers. Extremely hard to get a raise you have to go through a whole process and the same process just to keep the raise.

review_title: A good overall experience and the current CEO works hard to bring up  the employees
pros:
Departments and most sites close at 1pm on Fridays. Early out on fridays is a nice perk. 

Relaxed work environment help make the days better
cons:
Not enough mental challenges to keep me from being bored.

Pay is below market, however it has been improving. 

Some managers don't understand the job their trying to manage and are looking at numbers,

Different departments have inconsistent rules / guidelines which could be unified.

job_title: Lab Assistant II in Orlando, FL
pros: great teamwork, great PTO, off on weekend depending on location. off holidays, very flexible
cons: long work hours, no maternity leave

pros: Good pay and benefits including time off
cons: Formal, rigid corporate culture and the founder is known for being an intense micromanager

job_title: Front Desk in Winter Garden, FL
pros: Mission focused, helps underserved, established, offers benefits.
cons: Fast paced, tough patients. Not for those who don't want to work.

pros: A paycheck, decent facilities,  some of the coworkers that are team players.
cons: Management should be all wiped out and replaced.  They are running the company to ruins.  Every one is unhappy and the only reason they show up to work is because of a paycheck.   Scary thought being that it is a health care clinic.   The employees are stressed out and unhappy with the way things are ran.  The other reviewer got it right,  fear is placed by management on the employees that really matters,  the ones that take care of the patients day in and day out.  They can't keep good staff or doctors.   Only the management favorites and ones that can't do better for themselves stay.  Pittyfull place.  Too bad for the patients,  because the quality of care really lacks here and it all trickles down from management.

pros: the team in the billing department is a true joy to work with, they allow for a sense of family to follow through with. The work is manageable but can be a bit repetitive.
cons: The pay is not much and the management is a bit corrupt. The main CEO is always going out to eat on the company card. The executive board goes on extravagant vacations in the name of 'business' while they find it outrageous that we get paid near minimum wage for working constantly on the computers managing the billing records for medicare/medical/cencal.

pros: They have good benefits with multiple locations to work at and some leadership actually cares about you and the patients.
cons: This company is supposed to be an Orlando Top 100 company to work for, for families. Unless you get sick and get terminated during treatment.  A company whose job is healthcare and they fire someone for having to be out for cancer? This after nearly a decade of service.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Orlando, FL
pros: Great pay, incentives (insurance, LTD, STD, etc.), organized, decent hours.
cons:
Management to staff communication could be a lot better. Especially since most of the time they go on managers word as opposed to employee/witnesses. You'll get written up for just about anything if they feel like it or dislike you.
Creates an uncomfortable atmosphere and tension.

pros: They are in low income neighborhoods were many people wouldn't have access to affordable health care.
cons: Don't let the name fool you. This company has very little ties to the community. CHC is also not employee friendly.

pros: Federal dollars used to keep operations afloat provides security.
cons: The leaders allow HR to spit employees out like watermelon seeds. Enormous turnover and a ton of firing every month. Scary to work there because people constantly being fired even though they been fantastic to patients.

pros: Medical insurance, paid time off, patients, decent pay, benefits
cons: Corporate, high turn-over rate,
